LGTM, but be careful to upgrade. If the situation already happened at a server, then upgrade to this feature, it will miss some messages. It would be better to have some mechanism to keep consistency between consume queue and commitlog

@evthoriz , so the scenario is for huge message. 
Please modify the jira title to make it clearer.
But actually, I sent huge message before, but not able to reproduce it, so huge messages scenario 
 is only the necessary condition, it may also depends on other factor.

 Let's get more people involved. @vongosling @shroman @lizhanhui

@Jaskey Another key condition is the MASTER-SLAVE replicating mode, which is SYNC_MASTER in the case.
However, the option `syncFlushTimeout` is useless not only for big messages, but also those small messages. Small Messages just not trigger the bug, but it still exists.
@zhouxinyu @dongeforever please help review this PR.

@zhouxinyu  @vongosling  pls have a review ?
Hi, thanks for your contribution, but this command is to send messages to a specified broker and test the response time. So these descriptions and variables make sense, any thoughts?
Hi, thanks for your contribution. We could get FileReservedTime through `GetBrokerConfigCommand`, there is no need to add it to `runtimeInfo `.
LGTM, wake up `commitLogService` is for real-time, but it may let broker suffer from SSD write amplification, so provide a switch is reasonable.

@warning5 this pr has no files changed.

@warning5 It seems that you are testing how to submit a PR. 
Now could you please close this empty pr?

@wenweihu86 By default, the commitlog will flush in real-time. If enable flushCommitLogTimed, then it will flush at the interval.
So there is no need to sleep 100 ms, 10 is enough, just for the building time of consume queue.
@zd-double Thanks for your contribution. Just as @zhouxinyu said, it is test for sending to specified broker. Could you please close this PR and try another?
LGTM @zhouxinyu @vongosling

@zwillim I want to merge this PR. Could you please change the target branch to apache:develop ?
As all the PRs are merged into develop at first.
@evthoriz may you mock a test for this scenario?

@dongeforever  ok

@dongeforever thanks for your reply. I tried, but it seems that there's no easy way to mock a test for this, since the ha mechanism involves lots of salve replicating behavior. Do you have any good ideas?
@dongeforever The unit test of DefaultMessageStoreTest::testPullSize run failed for 10ms in my environment. Could you run successful?
@zhouxinyu @vongosling any idea about this?
